#6
We have been here now two and one half days with no air attack
which probably means a strong one or more
tomorrow,
unless
of course,
this weather continues.
There is an air of expectancy in Nanking, a
sort of indefinite tenseness which must get
on
everyone's nerves
sooner or later.
Possibly they get used
to it and probably I would
too, but frankly, I'll be glad to get away.
Will send this letter by Tuesday's plane to Hankow with the
hope that it will
catch Eurasia to Hongkong
Wednesday
and the Clipper
to Manila on Thursday. Next installment will follow
later.
We get little news here except about the Shanghai
front and
even that is mixed with all
sorts
Weren't the Japs
showing their real nature when they fired
at the
when they evacuated that warehouse and
surrendered to the British
for internment?
Those dirty little Japs haven't any decent traits.
Why didn't they cease firing and give those Chinese a rousing cheer
when they evacuated? That would have been sporting - but not at all
Japanese.
Tuesday, November 2,1937
If I remember correctly, this letter was started with the state-
ment that we were
embarking on a trip which might prove exciting.
Probably I too was a
victim of newspaper
torn China,
the air
filled with Japanese planes raining bombs on
defenceless
Chinese
plane -
and now after
more than a week in war torn China we have yet
experience. an
air raid
or see any signs of the war.
Nanking where hundreds of bombs have been dropped, it is difficult to
trace of
damage.
the "all clear"
This morning we had an air
raid alarm,
but
signal was given, and no planes or bombs
heard.
excitement
today except one air raia
the Embassy office across the
from Mr.Peck's
and inspected the U.S.dug out - very muddy, dark
and full of
mosquitos.
Think when the
raids come I'll take my
outside.
A direct hit will get you either in or out of that hole in the
If you are
and lie flat,
you are just about as
comfortable.
Bond left tonight by motor
for Shanghai.
nostly
at night, in
order to avoid Jap airplanes machine-gunning
ours left his car as a plane approached
field where there was a Chinese grave mound.
plane dove
but he stayed
in the lee of the mound until it passed - then he noticed
the Jap turn and come back at him, so he ran
the mound - again in the lee. This performance was repeated
during six
after which the Jap
flew off,
probably out
of
ammunition.
I hope
He is coming back on
